title: The Maze Game
subtitle: A Puzzle Adventure
description: A strategic puzzle game where players navigate through increasingly complex mazes, using blocks, keys, teleporters, and various obstacles to reach the endpoint.

sections.title: Level 1: Basic Maze Navigation
sections.content: The player begins in a simple maze environment. Learn to navigate around walls (@) and wall blocks, while managing moveable colored blocks (gray blocks marked as 'g'). The goal is to reach the green endpoint (e) while understanding basic movement mechanics.

sections.title: Level 2: Block Manipulation
sections.content: A more complex maze introduces strategic block placement. Players must push and arrange gray blocks (g) to create pathways through the maze. The level teaches advanced movement patterns and spatial reasoning as blocks can be pushed in chains.

sections.title: Level 3: Keys and Doors
sections.content: Introduction of key-door mechanics. Players must collect a yellow key (+) to open a brown closed door (c), which transforms into an open door allowing passage. Orange blocks (o) and gray holes (h) add complexity, requiring careful planning to avoid getting blocks stuck.

sections.title: Level 4: Teleportation System
sections.content: The most advanced level featuring colored teleporter pairs. Red-Purple teleporters (d-i), Blue-Orange teleporters (a-f), and Green-Gray teleporters (m-l) allow instant transportation across the maze. Players must master teleporter mechanics while still managing keys, doors, and block placement to reach the endpoint.

characters.name: Player
characters.description: A small figure represented by 'p' who navigates through the maze using arrow keys or movement commands.

mechanics.movement: Grid-based directional movement with push mechanics
mechanics.block_physics: Blocks can be pushed in chains and destroyed when three align
mechanics.teleportation: Colored teleporter pairs provide instant transport
mechanics.hazards: Gray holes stop movement, walls block passage
mechanics.victory: Reach the green endpoint to complete each level

game_elements.name: Wall (#)
game_elements.description: Impassable barriers that define maze structure

game_elements.name: Wall Block (@)
game_elements.description: Solid obstacles that cannot be moved or passed through

game_elements.name: Player (P/p)
game_elements.description: The controllable character navigating the maze

game_elements.name: Gray Blocks (g)
game_elements.description: Moveable blocks that can be pushed and destroyed in groups of three

game_elements.name: Colored Blocks (o,k,r,b)
game_elements.description: Special moveable blocks: Orange, Pink, Purple, and Red blocks with unique properties

game_elements.name: Gray Holes (h)
game_elements.description: Hazardous spaces that stop player and block movement

game_elements.name: Key (+)
game_elements.description: Collectible item that opens closed doors

game_elements.name: Closed Door (c)
game_elements.description: Locked barrier that requires a key to open

game_elements.name: Teleporters (a,d,f,i,l,m)
game_elements.description: Paired portals that transport player instantly: Blue-Orange (a-f), Red-Purple (d-i), Green-Gray (m-l)

game_elements.name: Endpoint (e)
game_elements.description: The green target location that completes the level

level_progression.focus: Advanced block manipulation and chain pushing
Master teleportation and complex puzzle solving

rules: Players can push moveable objects in straight lines
Three identical blocks in a row will disappear
Keys are consumed when opening doors
Teleporters transport player between paired locations
Victory requires reaching the green endpoint
